qas.question: What pecentage of sprayed pesticides affect the wrong species?
What is affected when pesticides don't reach their target?

answers.text: non-target species, air, water and soil

qas.question: What is it called when pesticides are caught in the wind and carried to unintended areas?
Pesticides contribute to what sort of pollution?
What is the effect of pesticide drift?
What are contaminated bugs living in water one of the causes of?
What percentage of species are able to live in polluted water?
What do animals digging in the soil for food contribute to?
What concerns are raised when thinking about animals digging in the soil for food?
What percentage of people want to eat organic food?

context: Pesticide use raises a number of <b8_0>environmental<b8_0/> concerns. <a0_0>Over <b6_0>98%<b6_0/><a0_0/> of sprayed insecticides and <b9_0>95%<b9_0/> of herbicides reach a destination other than their target species, including <a1_0>non-target species, air, water and soil<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Pesticide drift<a2_0/> occurs when pesticides suspended in the air as particles are carried by wind to other areas, <a4_0>potentially contaminating<a4_0/> them. Pesticides are one of the causes of <a3_0><b5_0>water pollution<b5_0/><a3_0/>, and some pesticides are persistent organic pollutants and contribute to <b7_0>soil contamination<b7_0/>.
